attributes.action: Vote of No Confidence to trigger a general election if the new PM is unelected
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron has resigned and as a result the next Conservative leader is likely to become Prime Minister unless they choose to gave a general election.
attributes.background: It is undemocratic to have an unelected Prime Minister with no mandate. The PM would have no legitimacy and therefore no right to lead the people in a democracy.
